value.name: ContinuousMovePtzCommand
value.description: Start PTZ continues move. Parameters xSpeed, ySpeed and zSpeed are used in range [-1.0..+1.0]. To stop moving use value 0 for all parameters.

value.name: ContinuousFocusPtzCommand
value.description: Start PTZ focus in or out. Parameter speed defines speed and focus direction in range [-1.0..+1.0].

value.name: AbsoluteDeviceMovePtzCommand
value.description: Move camera to absolute position. Parameters xPos, yPos and zPos are used in range defined by camera. Parameter speed is used in range [0..1.0].

value.name: AbsoluteLogicalMovePtzCommand
value.description: Move camera to absolute position. Parameters xPos, yPos range are: [-180..+180]. Parameter zPos range is: [0..180] (field of view in degree). Parameters speed range is: [0..1.0].

value.name: GetDevicePositionPtzCommand

value.name: GetLogicalPositionPtzCommand
value.description: Read camera current position. Return parameters xPos, yPos in range [-180..+180]. Return parameter zPos in range [0..180] (field of view in degree).

value.name: CreatePresetPtzCommand

value.name: UpdatePresetPtzCommand
value.description: Update PTZ preset display name. Parameter presetId defines internal preset name. Parameter presetName defines display preset name.

value.name: RemovePresetPtzCommand

value.name: ActivatePresetPtzCommand

group.groupDescription: This group contains information about accessing cameras' live video and footage.

function.name: <physicalId>
function.caption: RTSP Streaming
function.description: Open RTSP video from a camera. It is not an exact method name. It means that RTSP url may contain any camera unique ID. For instance: rtsp://<server_ip>:<port>/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p

param.name: pos
param.description: By default server opens camera from live position. This parameter defines position in an archive in milliseconds since epoch, microseconds since epoch or text date in ISO fomat (e.g., 2015-07-30T12:00:00). Position can be passed via standard RTSP attribute as well as via URL parameter

param.name: resolution
param.description: Turn on video transcoding to the specified resolution. Resolution string either may contain width and height (for instance 320x240) or height only (for instance 240p)

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree. If parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog. Parameter take place if video transcoding is activated (parameter codec and/or parameter resolution are presents.)

param.name: codec
param.description: Defines video codec used for transcoding. Default value H263.

param.name: stream
param.description: Open high quality stream if parameter is 0 or low quality stream if parameter is 1. By default server auto detect preferred stream index based on destination resolution.

param.name: speed
param.description: Playback speed. Only values in range [1..32] are supported. Default value is 1.

result.caption: Return RTSP video stream

function.name: media/<physicalId>.<format>
function.caption: HTTP Streaming
function.description: Url format for opening camera stream using HTTP protocol. Codec and stream format can be specified in url parameters. Live stream and archive can be downloaded. If required and possible, media stream transcoding is performed on-the-fly. Stream format can be one of following: webm, mpegts, mpjpeg (motion jpeg) Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/media/12AB42FD5912.webm

param.name: resolution
param.description: Video stream resolution. Example: 720x576, 1920x1080, 720p, 1080p. By default, 640x480 is used

param.name: pos
param.description: If present and not equal to <now>, specifies archive stream start positions milliseconds since epoch (1970-01-01 00:00, UTC), microseconds since epoch or text date in ISO fomat (e.g., 2015-07-30T12:00:00). Otherwise, LIVE stream is provided

param.name: endPos
param.description: If present then specifies archive stream end positions. It used only if 'pos' parameter is present. Milliseconds since epoch (1970-01-01 00:00, UTC), microseconds since epoch or text date in ISO fomat (e.g., 2015-07-30T12:00:00).

param.name: rotation
param.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degree. If parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog

param.name: sfd
param.description: Stand Frame Duration. If parameter is present, video speed is limited by real time.

param.name: rt
param.description: Turn on realtime optimization. It will drop some frames if not enough CPU for realtime transcoding.

result.caption: Video stream in requested format

function.name: hls/<physicalId>.m3u
function.caption: HLS Streaming
function.description: Url format for opening camera stream with Http Live Streaming (HLS). This protocol is supported by iOS-based devices (iPhone, iPad). Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.m3u

param.name: pos
param.description: Camera archive position to open. Can be: date/time in ISO format, server time zone (example: 2015-02-20T19:00), milliseconds since epoch (1970-01-01 00:00, UTC) or microseconds since epoch

param.name: hi
param.description: If specified, only hi quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

param.name: lo
param.description: If specified, only low quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

result.caption: Video stream in mpeg-2/ts format

function.name: hls/<physicalId>.<format>
function.caption: Direct download
function.description: Url format for downloading fragment of archive by specifying fragment start time and duration. Fragment can be downloaded in mpeg-2/ts (.ts) format or matroska (.mkv). No transcoding is done. Stream format can be one of following: ts, mkv Example: http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.mkv?startDatetime=2015-02-05T19:00&duration=10

group.groupDescription: Request authentication methods supported by server

function.name: HTTP Basic / Digest Authentication
function.description: Server is fully conformant with authentication defined in rfc2617 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617)

function.name: Cookie-based Authentication
function.description:
Cookie authorization scheme allows to avoid standard login/password dialog in web-applications.
It provides you a way to replace it with your own.
It works mostly like sessions, but a bit more secure because it doesn't send user's password over HTTP.
In the first request to server you must send cookie Authorization=Digest (path: '/') You can request any anonymous request like '/api/moduleInformation'
In response you'll get cookies realm and nonce (nonce is a session key for this user)
Calculate authentification hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
Set authentification hash to cookie: auth=auth_digest (path: '/') Every following request to server must contain cookies: Authorization and auth

function.name: URL-based Authentication
function.description:
You can add "auth" field to url query section. E.g., http://127.0.0.1:7001/ec2/getMediaServersEx?auth=auth_digest
Call /gettime request to get realm and nonce from server (current server time MUST be used as a nonce value, nonce is valid for about 5 minutes)
Calculate authentification hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
Set authentification hash to url-parameter: http://127.0.0.1:7001/ec2/method?...&auth=auth_digest

function.name: Calculating authentification hash
function.description:
For url-based authentification and cookie-based authentification you need to calculate hash manually, using the following algorythm:
Get nonce and realm from server
Translate user's username to lower case
Check required method ('GET' for http-requests, 'PLAY' for rtsp)
ha1 = MD5(usename:realm:password)
simplified_ha2 = MD5(ha1:nonce:MD5(method:))
auth = base64(username:nonce:simplified_ha2)
auth is required authentification hash
